_comment_1: All flows (student, veteran, parentGuardian) are independent i.e. content ids that are the same need to be updated in all flows
_comment_2: All messages are generic i.e. they are for all flows. Except for some messages within the student flow which are overrides of the generic messages

student.pageheaderFinal: Your claim for Education Assistance has been submitted
student.id4: Date of birth (DD / MM / YYYY)
student.id6: Are you employed full time? This does not include apprenticeships.
student.id7: Are you married or in a de facto relationship?
student.id7a: Are you living with your partner?
student.id8: Are you living away from home for any of the above reasons?
student.id9b: Provide any supporting documents to prove your relationship to the student.
student.id19: Date you started studying, or will start studying (DD / MM / YYYY)
student.id20: Approximate date when you expect to complete your course/degree (DD / MM / YYYY)
student.id21a: Tell us more about your situation. Why are you studying part time? (optional)For example, health reasons, isolated location, family situation.
student.id21ci: Save and exit your claim. You can return and continue when you have proof of enrolment.
student.id24a1: When did you start renting? (DD / MM / YYYY)
student.id24a7: How much rent do you pay every 2 weeks?
student.id24a8: Do you share the cost of rent with anyone else?
student.id24a9: When did you start boarding / lodging? (DD / MM / YYYY)
student.id24a9a: How much do you pay in board every 2 weeks? (minus the cost of meals)
student.id24a9b: Tell us more about your living situation
student.id26: Who receives the Family Tax Benefit for the student?
student.id26a: What is your Centrelink Customer Reference Number (CRN)?
student.id26b: Does someone else receive Family Tax Benefit for the student?
student.id33a: Are you dependent on the veteran? Or were you previously? Completely or substantially
student.id33b:
Is the veteran significantly injured or deceased because of their service? For example:
  • the veteran has 80 impairment points
  • the veteran is totally and permanently impaired
  • the veteran is eligible for an extreme disablement adjustment rate
  • the veteran is, or was, eligible for the special rate disability pension
student.id44: Veteran's date of birth (DD / MM / YYYY)
student.id45: Veteran's DVA file number (if known)
student.id48: Please provide a brief statement explaining how you came into the veteran’s care.
student.id50a: Apply for a tax file number and avoid paying extra tax.
student.id53: Would you like DVA to withhold tax from this payment?
student.id54: How much would you like to withhold per fortnight for tax? For information about payments go to the DVA website
student.id55: Do you have a tax file number?
student.message9:
Extra support may be available if you are living away from home for any of the following reasons:

  • you can't access school or university from home
  • you have a disability
  • you need specialised remedial education
  • you are a member of a family with a nomadic lifestyle
  • local schools or education facilities can't meet your academic needs
  • conditions at home are detrimental to your education
student.message15: If your parent or guardian previously received this payment for you, we may need to contact them to confirm you can get the payment.
student.message16: You need to apply for a tax file number from the Australian Taxation Office to avoid your payment being taxed at a higher amount.
student.message17:
This payment is considered taxable income. If you are approved for this payment and this is your only income this financial year, you may not have to pay any tax.

However, you may have to pay tax if you have other income this financial year, such as salary or wages.

If you think you will have to pay tax, you can ask us to deduct tax instalments from your payment. You can change this amount at any time.

If you're not sure how much tax to have taken out of your payment, go to the Australian Taxation Office website or call the ATO Personal Tax Enquiries Line on 13 28 61.
student.message18: If you are earning other income, such as salary or wages, you may have to pay additional tax at the end of the financial year.
student.messageeligibilityUnder16: Students under the age of 16 need their parent or guardian to make the claim.
student.messageeligibilityOver25: You may not be eligible if you haven’t started your course. If you enrolled after you turned 25 you are not eligible for education allowance. For more information call 1800 555 254
student.messageeligibilityOver25notenrolled: You are not eligible for education allowance because you are over 25. For more information call 1800 555 254

messages.message1: Students over the age of 26 are not eligible for education allowance.
messages.message2: Students over the age of 18 need to complete the claim themselves.
messages.message3: The student must be at least 4 years old to claim for education allowance.
messages.message4: Students who are working full time may not be eligible for education allowance. For more information call 1800 555 254.
messages.message5: You may not be eligible for education allowance. For more information call 1800 555 254.
messages.message6: You can't claim both education allowance and Family Tax Benefit (FTB) payments if the student is over 16. Often it is best to choose FTB as it may be a higher payment rate. For FTB information call 136 150. For education allowance, call 1800 555 254.
messages.message7: The person receiving Family Tax Benefit will need to claim for education allowance.
messages.message8: Students who are working full time are not eligible for education allowance. For more information call 1800 555 254.
messages.message9:
Extra support may be available if {{studentNameFirst}} is living away from home for any of the following reasons:

  • the student can't access school or university from home
  • the student has a disability
  • the student needs specialised remedial education
  • the student is a member of a family with a nomadic lifestyle
  • local schools or education facilities can't meet the student's academic needs
  • conditions at home are detrimental to the student's education
messages.message16: {{studentNameFirst}} needs to apply for a tax file number from the Australian Taxation Office to avoid the payment being taxed at a higher amount.
messages.message17:
This payment is considered the student's taxable income. If the student is approved for this payment and this is their only income this financial year, they may not have to pay any tax.

However, they may have to pay tax if they have other income this financial year, such as salary or wages.

If you think the student will have to pay tax, you can ask us to deduct tax instalments from the payment. You can change this amount at any time.

If you're not sure how much tax to have taken out of this payment, go to the Australian Taxation Office website or call the ATO Personal Tax Enquiries Line on 13 28 61.
messages.message18: If the student is earning other income, such as salary or wages, they may have to pay additional tax at the end of the financial year.
messages.message19:
Your application is being assessed.

You will receive an outcome within 30 days. If you do not hear from us within this time you can call 133 254. You will be notified of your application outcome by mail and a MyGov notification.
